content:
In the Treatment by Chinese Physician section, if Your Maid sustains an Injury and seeks treatment from a Chinese Physician, We will reimburse up to the Benefit Limit, subject to the Sub-Limit per Accident as specified in the Policy Schedule for the Chinese Physician Treatment Expenses, necessarily and reasonably incurred and supported by receipts.

In the Physiotherapy section, if Your Maid sustains an Injury and requires treatment/rehabilitation from a Physiotherapist, We will reimburse up to the Benefit Limit, subject to the Sub-Limit per year as specified in the Policy Schedule, for the physiotherapy expenses necessarily and reasonably incurred and supported by receipts.

# Section 2. Hospital & Surgical Expenses
questions: What is the reimbursement limit for treatment by a Chinese Physician?
Are there any specific conditions for reimbursement of Chinese Physician treatment expenses?
What documentation is required to claim reimbursement for physiotherapy expenses?
Is there a yearly limit for physiotherapy expenses under the policy?
What happens if the treatment expenses exceed the Benefit Limit?
Can I claim for both Chinese Physician and Physiotherapist treatments for the same injury?
What is meant by 'necessarily and reasonably incurred' in the context of treatment expenses?
Where can I find the Sub-Limit per Accident for Chinese Physician treatment?
Are there any exclusions for treatments provided by a Chinese Physician?
How do I submit a claim for hospital and surgical expenses?
